snippet.textDisplay: Here is my two cents, take it or leave it. Like all other games, this game will cater to the loud minority which is the PvP crowd, streamer types that are upset with CoD. When that happens, this game will die and their 10 year plan will be for nought. You will never get the PvP Brainrot to go away, they will always focus on killing players for the sheer sport of the easy kill, because there is no skill involved. And then we will miss the game, and we will come back and ask what happened.
snippet.textOriginal: Here is my two cents, take it or leave it. Like all other games, this game will cater to the loud minority which is the PvP crowd, streamer types that are upset with CoD. When that happens, this game will die and their 10 year plan will be for nought. You will never get the PvP Brainrot to go away, they will always focus on killing players for the sheer sport of the easy kill, because there is no skill involved. And then we will miss the game, and we will come back and ask what happened.

snippet.textDisplay: I love the look and aesthetics of the characters, and really my only hope for cosmetics would be that they continue to keep it grounded in the reality of the game world. For example, given the lore behind Spaceport, the Luna set makes sense. It‚Äôs not a MIL-SIM, so don‚Äôt go so far down that route, but also don‚Äôt get so over the top that you lose visual and tonal consistency.
snippet.textOriginal: I love the look and aesthetics of the characters, and really my only hope for cosmetics would be that they continue to keep it grounded in the reality of the game world. For example, given the lore behind Spaceport, the Luna set makes sense. It‚Äôs not a MIL-SIM, so don‚Äôt go so far down that route, but also don‚Äôt get so over the top that you lose visual and tonal consistency.

snippet.textDisplay: Counter point for around 19:00. As an avid player coming from Hunt Showdown, I can attest to how passive ai can still pose a threat even after learning how to efficiently  deal with them. Although you maybe able to dispatch these with ease, they now become sound traps and resource drains in the run, and the sheer numbers start to play a factor. Sure, I can easily kill some wasps and a hornet, but the shots now aggroed a rocketeer, or now the team nearby has chance to take advantage. It's what I love about maps with good Ai mobs. The sheer dynamic possibilities keep the danger alive even in the sweeties of runs.
snippet.textOriginal: Counter point for around 19:00. As an avid player coming from Hunt Showdown, I can attest to how passive ai can still pose a threat even after learning how to efficiently  deal with them. Although you maybe able to dispatch these with ease, they now become sound traps and resource drains in the run, and the sheer numbers start to play a factor. Sure, I can easily kill some wasps and a hornet, but the shots now aggroed a rocketeer, or now the team nearby has chance to take advantage. It's what I love about maps with good Ai mobs. The sheer dynamic possibilities keep the danger alive even in the sweeties of runs.

snippet.textDisplay:
Stella Montis map description:  "The tubes leading to this location are heavily trapped, but disarming is already being planned..."  

Idea:  it would be cool if when unlocking a new map/area, they included a story driven PvE event, where you have to play through it the first time to get to the new area (i.e., storywise, you are part of that team/process to unlock and push into the new area).
snippet.textOriginal:
Stella Montis map description:  "The tubes leading to this location are heavily trapped, but disarming is already being planned..."  

Idea:  it would be cool if when unlocking a new map/area, they included a story driven PvE event, where you have to play through it the first time to get to the new area (i.e., storywise, you are part of that team/process to unlock and push into the new area).

snippet.textDisplay: The cinematic aspect of this game blows my mind at times. We were walking through a tunnel. Listening to some commotion above. We reached the room at the end when a Leaper fell in. Crashing and twisting as it fell right in front of us. We threw a couple grenades and ran as it lumbered down the tunnel at us. It was awesome, I've seen scripted events that didn't seem as epic. Keep it up Embark! Looks like I'll have a steady for of great entertainment for the next 10 years!
snippet.textOriginal: The cinematic aspect of this game blows my mind at times. We were walking through a tunnel. Listening to some commotion above. We reached the room at the end when a Leaper fell in. Crashing and twisting as it fell right in front of us. We threw a couple grenades and ran as it lumbered down the tunnel at us. It was awesome, I've seen scripted events that didn't seem as epic. Keep it up Embark! Looks like I'll have a steady for of great entertainment for the next 10 years!

snippet.textDisplay:
8:55 20 $ is A BIT over the top? The Game took years to develop, thousands of dev. hours, assets, textures, models and so on. For 40 $. A skin took them...what? 1/10000 of that effort to make. So, it should cost 1/10000 of the price. Ok it‚Äôs a bundle, let's say 1/1000. 0,04 $ is the price, it should cost, based on their game price tag. Ok, they want to make money (what they already did, the game is a great success) so let‚Äôs say 10 time more. Still 0,4 $. Ok the game is really great and they listen to the community, 100 time more. 4 $. Ok I can live with that. But 500 times more‚Ä¶uff. ‚ÄúA bit over the top‚Äù a huge understatement. An don‚Äôt tell me ‚ÄúEverybody doing it.‚Äù, it‚Äôs the most stupid reason to do something.
I love the game, but those greedy, √ºber capitalist price tags on virtual goods, that have no rl value make me sad.
snippet.textOriginal:
8:55 20 $ is A BIT over the top? The Game took years to develop, thousands of dev. hours, assets, textures, models and so on. For 40 $. A skin took them...what? 1/10000 of that effort to make. So, it should cost 1/10000 of the price. Ok it‚Äôs a bundle, let's say 1/1000. 0,04 $ is the price, it should cost, based on their game price tag. Ok, they want to make money (what they already did, the game is a great success) so let‚Äôs say 10 time more. Still 0,4 $. Ok the game is really great and they listen to the community, 100 time more. 4 $. Ok I can live with that. But 500 times more‚Ä¶uff. ‚ÄúA bit over the top‚Äù a huge understatement. An don‚Äôt tell me ‚ÄúEverybody doing it.‚Äù, it‚Äôs the most stupid reason to do something.
I love the game, but those greedy, √ºber capitalist price tags on virtual goods, that have no rl value make me sad.

snippet.textDisplay:
For me, THE no.1 thing they need to look into is fixing the shutdown/crashes for AMD users.

Running an updated UEFI/BIOS and motherboard drivers, latest graphics drivers on a 7800X3D + RX9060XT 16GB + 32GB 6000MHz + B650 + W10 system.
Keeps happening. sometimes in the menu, sometimes in a raid

snippet.textDisplay: i love this game but my question is why is it so hard to get clothes????  what do you mean i pay full price for a game and none of the character creation is good and the stuff to make my character look cool i have to grind for or pay money for???? why didn't they just make the game free to play at that point??? these dude gave me an outfit at level 10 and i can't even get the full head gear until im like level 50 or something??? oh and not to mention the fit isn't fully complete until you hit level 73 or something just for a camera to be on your side lol you cant even mix and match. idk about other people but character customization is a big thing for me and i don't mind paying for it but i don't feel i should have to after paying full price for a game

snippet.textDisplay: Console Mouse Support for Inventory Management!.. When you click Inventory - allow mouse support. In game looting and sorting is bad (not fast enough).  And one personal wish that would have made me play the game would have been : Don't touch my guns.. i.e. That is player looses loot but not weapons..like Division. These 2 things would have made me not drop the game so early.. But Cheers guys - enjoy..
snippet.textOriginal: Console Mouse Support for Inventory Management!.. When you click Inventory - allow mouse support. In game looting and sorting is bad (not fast enough). snippet.textDisplay: honestly, while an exclusively underground system of a map being the main draw is a cool idea, it being the sweat grounds is probably not going to resonate with the casual flow and audience this game is going for, it is called topside for a reason I think and the closest translation from latin for the map is star of the mountain, my guess is that blue gate is like the base camp of the mountains before we see the actual mountains themselves, likely WAY more environmentally hostile, and I dont doubt the bunkers inside of the mountains will play the biggest roles in loot
snippet.textOriginal: honestly, while an exclusively underground system of a map being the main draw is a cool idea, it being the sweat grounds is probably not going to resonate with the casual flow and audience this game is going for, it is called topside for a reason I think and the closest translation from latin for the map is star of the mountain, my guess is that blue gate is like the base camp of the mountains before we see the actual mountains themselves, likely WAY more environmentally hostile, and I dont doubt the bunkers inside of the mountains will play the biggest roles in loot
